title: command core:delete-logs-data will not delete unused rows from log_action table

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: For errors / faults / flaws.

milestone.title: Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: This is our backlog of issues. Help wanted!

body:
When trying to [manage the database size](https://piwik.org/docs/managing-your-databases-size) one can:

1. configure the user interface and configure Piwik to "Delete old visitor logs from the database". When enabled, a scheduled task will be executed at the end of `core:archive` command which will purge the old data as per the settings selected in the UI.

2. or one can manually run a console command `core:delete-logs-data` to delete old visit data

One may expect that both 1) and 2) do the same thing. However 2) will not purge the un-used records from the `log_action` table. In one case reported to us, this table log_action was 170G big and we expected `core:delete-logs-data` to purge many Gb from this table.

The workaround for now is to use technique 1) and configure the "delete old logs data" using the Administration > Privacy > Delete old visitor logs. Use [TasksTimetable plugin](http://plugins.piwik.org/TasksTimetable) to see when the task will be executed.

title: Build in cli Installer

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

body:
Sometimes an automated process for installation eg. for a hosting service provider or even people who run the piwik via docker container. 

So to be able to run a command such as:
```
php console install
```

By default the `install` option would look for a `config.ini.php` and will:

* Generate the database
* Install basic Modules (the ones that not installed). If no plugin is defined it will auto setups the basic plugins needed except a `--no-plugin` option is provided.

Also I suggest this frature to have theese options too:

* Database only Setup:
```
php console install:database
```

* Plugin Only Setup:
```
php console install:plugin
```

Also I suggest to have options in order to specifying database connection crendentials and plugins.

title: Unique Visitors missing in Referrer breakdowns when using period other than daily

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: For errors / faults / flaws.

milestone.title: Priority Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: Most important issues we should tackle next. If you can help: please join the discussion and/or issue a pull request ([help](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/contributing-to-piwik-core)).

body:
In Referrers breakdowns, Unique Visitors column is not available for anything but "daily" periods.

We're on Piwik 2.17.1, and we have enabled UV processing for all periods following Faq#113 by using

```
[General]
enable_processing_unique_visitors_day = 1
enable_processing_unique_visitors_week = 1
enable_processing_unique_visitors_month = 1
enable_processing_unique_visitors_year = 1
enable_processing_unique_visitors_range = 1
```
We re-generated archived reports, but on the tables on the "Referrers"/"All Referrers" page, the "Unique Visitors" column is only shown for daily periods.

What we're seeing can also be seen on demo.piwiki.org:

When navigating to (period parameter is "daily"):

http://demo.piwik.org/index.php?module=CoreHome&action=index&idSite=3&period=day&date=yesterday#?idSite=3&period=day&date=yesterday&category=Referrers_Referrers&subcategory=Referrers_WidgetGetAll

The third column in both the "Referrer Types" and "Referrers" tables is "Unique Visitors". So the numbers we're looking for are available for daily periods.

But when changing the period to weekly, the "Unique Visitors" column disappears. E.g.:

http://demo.piwik.org/index.php?module=CoreHome&action=index&idSite=3&period=day&date=yesterday#?idSite=3&period=week&date=2017-01-09&category=Referrers_Referrers&subcategory=Referrers_WidgetGetAll

On that page, the "Referrer Types" and "Referrers" tables are missing the "Unique Visitors" column.


Is there a way to get the "Unique Visitors" column also for other-than-daily periods per referrer?

[Forum discussion](https://forum.piwik.org/t/unique-visitors-missing-in-referrer-breakdowns-when-using-period-other-than-daily/22558) suggested to file this issue here at github.

title: Can not read the filename in the downloads view

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: For new feature suggestions that for example enhance Matomo's cabapilities..

labels.description: For issues that let users achieve a defined goal more effectively or efficiently.

milestone.description: Most important issues we should tackle next. If you can help: please join the discussion and/or issue a pull request ([help](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/contributing-to-piwik-core)).

body:
I use Piwik 3.0.0, and had some of the previous versions, too. I use it without JS tracking, just by importing server logs. 
Now I need information about **which file is downloaded the most**. The problem with the downloads overview is, that "hierarcical" view only groups the url of the site, not the path of the file (like in the page view).
As we have very long URLs for the downloads, you need a very big monitor to actually see the filename as it is the last part of the URL. In my opinion this contradicts the responsive paradigm of Piwik 3.0.0. On mobile devices there is no chance for me to see which file is downloaded, just the very first part of the download url.

Btw: I already opend a ticket with a solution ([https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/11069](https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/11069)) which was not accepted. Now I only want to mention my problem and let you find a solution ;-)

title: Can't get auth token from the Piwik API (v3) for a specific user / newly created user

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

labels.name: c: New plugin
labels.description: For features that probably will not be added to Matomo, but could be implemented as plugins.

milestone.title: Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: This is our backlog of issues. Help wanted!

body:
Hi there! 

After upgrading Piwik to v3, the removal of auth tokens from the list of users / specific user / newly created user broke my application, so I fixed it but now I can't get the auth token using the Piwik API in order to log the users in using an iframe. 

I use the `getTokenAuth()` method but that causes a new error when trying to log in the user using that auth token, and the error `Error: You can't access this resource as it requires an 'view' access for the website id = 91.` shows up. The weird part is that the site id 91 has view access already when I run the `getSitesAccessFromUser()` method to check the access of all sites (in my case, the user has one site).

I've read about this problem [on the forums](https://forum.piwik.org/t/usersmanager-getusers-broken-in-3-0-0/22363) and #10938 but can't find a solution.

Any ideas how can I get the auth token through the Piwik API? I don't have access to the Piwik Database.

title: Release Piwik 3.0.1
body:
Checklist for a successful release:
- [x] Beta release cycle has started with the first beta release!
- [x] Forum support: regularly check all posts in [Support & Bugs forum](http://forum.piwik.org/c/support-bugs)
- [x] Forum General questions: look for bugs & regressions in [General questions forum](http://forum.piwik.org/c/general-questions) 
- [x] Backlog grooming: [check issues without milestone](https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+no%3Amilestone) if any one should be fixed in this release 
- [x] Check [this list of issues across all Piwik repositories](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+user%3Apiwik+milestone%3A%22Current+sprint%22), where the milestone is set to `Current sprint` 
- [x] Make [CI builds](https://travis-ci.org/piwik/) of our official plugins `piwik/plugin-*` all green 
- [x] Tag a new release for `piwik/referrer-spam-blacklist` and `piwik/searchengine-and-social-list`
- [x] Fetch our latest and greatest home-made libraries with `composer update piwik/referrer-spam-blacklist piwik/searchengine-and-social-list piwik/piwik-php-tracker piwik/component-network,piwik/component-ini,piwik/component-decompress,piwik/component-cache`
- [ ] Fetch the latest composer libraries for all with `composer update`
- [x] Up to date submodules
- [ ] Tag the RC candidate 
- [x] Check that the build is green
- [ ] [Package & release](https://github.com/piwik/piwik-package#core-piwik-package) the Release Candidate
- [ ] Post sticky thread in forum [about RC](http://forum.piwik.org/t/2-15-0-rc-release-your-feedback-is-important/16484), 
- [ ] inform RC release on social media 
- [ ] Release candidate cycle (at least 1 week cycle)
- [x] Fix all remaining issues in the milestone
- [ ] All open source plugins builds are green on `master` with latest RC
- [ ] Plugins that needed a version bump are now released on the marketplace.
- [x] Synchronise translations from transifex 
- [x] Up to date submodules
- [x] Prepare the [Changelog entry](http://piwik.org/changelog/) for the new release: 
 - [x] Mark that the release has a major DB upgrade
 - [x] Use [our github changelog generator](https://github.com/piwik/github-changelog-generator) to generate the changelog [using this `config.js`](https://github.com/piwik/github-changelog-generator#sample-configjs-file)
 - [x] Add to changelog any new issues or FAQ added since first RC
 - [x] Add to changelog the security issues fixed, if any
 - [x] Do not publish publicly the changelog yet. This also ensures security issues are not publicly visible until the stable release.
 - [x] Change changelog published date to the release day
- [x] For each issue in the changelog:
 - [x] is this issue relevant to developers? let's mention it in the [Developer changelog](http://developer.piwik.org/changelog)
 - [x] is this issue's title descriptive and useful to people scanning our changelog? 
 - [x] are the right labels applied to the issue? (issues tagged with labels such as `Bug`, `Enhancement`, `Major` are grouped together in the changelog)
 - [x] if this [issue was sponsored](https://piwik.org/development/), we note the sponsor organisation in the changelog.
- [x] Close milestone on Github
- [x] Release publicly the new stable version!
- [x] In Github release write 

```
## [Piwik XYZ Changelog](https://piwik.org/changelog/piwik-XYZ/)

This Github download (below) is only meant for developers and it will require extra work to install it. 
 commands data-understanding.ipynb drafts.json drafts.py ex.sh get_issues.py json2csv.py matomo17202.json matomo-org trial.ipynb Latest stable production release can be found at https://piwik.org/download/ ([learn more](https://piwik.org/docs/installation/)) (recommended)
 commands data-understanding.ipynb drafts.json drafts.py ex.sh get_issues.py json2csv.py matomo17202.json matomo-org trial.ipynb Beta and Release Candidates releases can be found at https://builds.piwik.org/ ([learn more](http://piwik.org/faq/how-to-update/faq_159/))

```
- [ ] Take screenshots of new features + draft a blog post showcasing what's new 

(follows up [2.16.3 release](https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/10526))

title: Improve icons and images in piwik

labels.name: c: Design / UI
labels.description: For issues that impact Matomo's user interface or the design overall.

body: Follow-up to #10587 and similar to #9292 There are still many low resolution icons left in piwik: - Flags: - Personally I don't like the "glossy" look of the current flags. (e.g ![fr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581830/ccbf8440-d041-11e6-9468-df3bcee04be8.png)) - There are many libraries providing official flags as svg (mostly from wikipedia | e.g [lipis/flag-icon-css](https://github.com/lipis/flag-icon-css)) - After some tries I realized that converting the svg to 16px png images isn't enough. While some simple flags look better (in my opinion, like ![at](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581851/7870c0ec-d042-11e6-9bae-2f37c8135171.png), ![fr](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581856/8544fc5c-d042-11e6-8f17-cf81ceb47ac1.png) or ![ch](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581860/c89639d0-d042-11e6-9535-7ef50b042b3b.png)) ~others get ugly as too much detail is lost. (![pk](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581864/eb720aec-d042-11e6-8cc3-427fa976d0b1.png), ![us](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581863/d5f532f2-d042-11e6-9d75-d79426211a20.png), ![sz](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581872/220c86ea-d043-11e6-9fde-f61cd42fdace.png), ![ba](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21581875/3bb27a78-d043-11e6-99e3-7273beb64424.png))~ - ~I'm not sure what to do as it is pretty hard to show many details in 192 Pixel total (16x12)~ This got better by increasing the icon size to 64x48px: ,,, - I would suggest keeping the height at 16px (48px) even if this means being a bit wider than the other icons, as they would fit better in line. - [old](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21582108/58952c50-d04b-11e6-8f24-495952351f06.png) vs. [new](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21742341/dc4b105a-d4ec-11e6-9221-e9ba481fbffd.png) - DevicesDetection/images/screens - In my opinion it's quite important to replace these (11) icons, as they are extremely pixelated next to the new icons ![6083834a-d13a-11e6-9ffb-38dd847ed4ad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6266037/21742358/5d8fd894-d4ed-11e6-914f-648c2d1cba6a.PNG) - Anybody got an idea what icons to use. I [haven't found](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Computer_monitor_icons) pretty ones. - DevicesDetection/images/brand - I'd suggest creating a list of most common brands and only replace the icons for them. (https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/10587#issuecomment-269909494) But there are still many single icons left (either in Morpheus or in the `images` folders of the core plugins). Best would be to recreate them a vector image and maybe even embed them as svg.

Piwik 2 is in LTS mode. This means we do not accept any pull request for 2.x except critical security bugs and major data loss bugs.

Happy hacking!

title: Update to 3.0.0 breaks dashboard if server does not support `Options -Indexes` in ".htaccess" files

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

body:
When updating Piwik using the automatic update process from the last version to the most recent version 3.0.0, the dashboard is broken. This means, that no icons and widgets are shown in the backend.

The problem seems to be caused by the line `Options -Indexes` in the ".htaccess" files in Piwik's "plugins" and "libs" folders, which is not supported by the server. Excerpt from the server's log files:

`Options not allowed here, referer: <URL>`

Piwik is hosted on shared hosting and changing options is disabled by the provider.

The problem can be fixed by commenting out the above-mentioned line (`#Options -Indexes`). However, we are unsure if this fix is safe and what's the recommended solution for this problem.

(Discussion on the forum: https://forum.piwik.org/t/no-more-dashboard-after-upgrade-to3-0/22182)

title: Automatically delete non-expected files from the filesystem

milestone.title: Priority Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: Most important issues we should tackle next. If you can help: please join the discussion and/or issue a pull request ([help](https://developer.matomo.org/guides/contributing-to-piwik-core)).

body:
in #11096 and #11107 we introduced a new feature where the file integrity checker now also checks for files which are present in the Piwik filesystem, but are not expected. 

Often these are files that used to be in previous Piwik versions but were removed afterwards. our automatic updater should automatically delete these files, but it was only introduced during 2.X cycle so many un-expected files will be present for users who used Piwik for a long time.

See an example of such files reported here: https://github.com/piwik/piwik/issues/11107#issuecomment-269940398

Ideas:
* Maybe we could delete all these files automatically?
* Or maybe we delete files only in some specific folders to avoid over-deleting (eg. `vendor/`, `libs/`)

title: P3.0.1b2: File integrity check failed: 280+ errors

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

body:
There were 280+ unexpected files found by file integrity check.

Haven't seen this message before updating to P3.0.1b2...

It's an approx 2 old installation continuously updated.

=> should one really delete all of them?

Complete message:

 	File integrity check failed and reported some errors. You should fix this issue and then refresh this page until it shows no error.

`word-wrap: break-word` wraps the commands, while only breaking if necessary.

The text is still copyable without a newline.

labels.name: c: Design / UI
labels.description: For issues that impact Matomo's user interface or the design overall.

body:
Bug report from facebook:

> A small bug you may want to fix: in the installation, when your directories aren't writable, the names of the directories that need to be made writable can't be read: the content area is too narrow. https://i.stack.imgur.com/5sIk0.jpg This is because of line 18 in simple_structure.css that sets a "max-width: 780px". Removing that property makes it readable.

title: Users are converting but not retaining pre-conversion history in visitor log

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: For new feature suggestions that for example enhance Matomo's cabapilities..

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

body:
Summary: when a visitor triggers a signup goal, we register them and associate their userid to piwik for tracking. 

However, all pre-goal-conversion visit history for that user is orphaned as an anonymous visitor, in that, it's not showing under the userid for that visitor when viewing the log or custom dimension reports. Piwik seems to attribute all pre-conversion history (including the conversion itself) to an anonymous visitor with the same IP and shows post-conversion history to the userId profile.

I swear piwik used to combine pre and post conversion history under one userID once the anonymous user signed in or registered. Is this a bug or as designed? What am I missing?

I am using 2.16.1

title: Reporting API with format=php returning unknown objects __PHP_Incomplete_Class __PHP_Incomplete_Class_Name

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: For errors / faults / flaws.

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: For issues that already existed in our issue tracker and were reported previously.

labels.name: answered
labels.description: For when a question was asked and we referred to forum or answered it.

milestone.title: Backlog (Help wanted)
milestone.description: This is our backlog of issues. Help wanted!

body:
According to [Serializing objects - objects in sessions](https://secure.php.net/manual/en/language.oop5.serialization.php):

> In order to be able to unserialize() an object, the class of that object needs to be defined. That is, if you have an object of class A and serialize this, you'll get a string that refers to class A and contains all values of variables contained in it. If you want to be able to unserialize this in another file, an object of class A, the definition of class A must be present in that file first.

It appears Piwik 3 Live.getVisitorProfile API command (i.e., index.php?module=API&method=Live.getVisitorProfile) is now returning serialized objects (in this case lastVisits). For example, here is a sample unserialized response:

```
array(24) {
 ["totalVisits"]=>
 int(1)
 ["totalVisitDuration"]=>
 int(4)
 ["totalActions"]=>
 int(2)
 ["totalEvents"]=>
 int(0)
 ["totalOutlinks"]=>
 int(0)
 ["totalDownloads"]=>
 int(0)
 ["totalSearches"]=>
 int(0)
 ["totalPageViews"]=>
 int(2)
 ["totalPageViewsWithTiming"]=>
 int(2)
 ["totalGoalConversions"]=>
 int(0)
 ["totalConversionsByGoal"]=>
 array(0) {
 }
 ["hasLatLong"]=>
 bool(true)
 ["searches"]=>
 array(0) {
 }
 ["continents"]=>
 array(1) {
 [0]=>
 array(3) {
 ["continent"]=>
 string(3) "amn"
 ["nb_visits"]=>
 int(1)
 ["prettyName"]=>
 string(13) "North America"
 }
 }
 ["countries"]=>
 array(1) {
 [0]=>
 array(5) {
 ["country"]=>
 string(2) "us"
 ["nb_visits"]=>
 int(1)
 ["flag"]=>
 string(39) "plugins/UserCountry/images/flags/us.png"
 ["prettyName"]=>
 string(13) "United States"
 ["cities"]=>
 array(1) {
 [0]=>
 string(7) "*******"
 }
 }
 }
 ["averagePageGenerationTime"]=>
 float(0.7)
 ["totalVisitDurationPretty"]=>
 string(2) "4s"
 ["firstVisit"]=>
 array(5) {
 ["date"]=>
 int(1482949717)
 ["prettyDate"]=>
 string(28) "Wednesday, December 28, 2016"
 ["daysAgo"]=>
 int(0)
 ["referrerType"]=>
 string(6) "direct"
 ["referralSummary"]=>
 string(12) "Direct Entry"
 }
 ["lastVisit"]=>
 array(5) {
 ["date"]=>
 int(1482949717)
 ["prettyDate"]=>
 string(28) "Wednesday, December 28, 2016"
 ["daysAgo"]=>
 int(0)
 ["referrerType"]=>
 string(6) "direct"
 ["referralSummary"]=>
 string(12) "Direct Entry"
 }
 ["visitsAggregated"]=>
 int(1)
 ["nextVisitorId"]=>
 string(16) "b62bae85fc4b8de5"
 ["previousVisitorId"]=>
 bool(false)
 ["lastVisits"]=>
 object(__PHP_Incomplete_Class)#41 (3) {
 ["__PHP_Incomplete_Class_Name"]=>
 string(15) "Piwik\DataTable"
 ["rows":protected]=>
 array(1) {
 [0]=>
 object(__PHP_Incomplete_Class)#414 (1) {
 ["__PHP_Incomplete_Class_Name"]=>
 string(19) "Piwik\DataTable\Row"
 }
 }
 ["summaryRow":protected]=>
 NULL
 }
 ["userId"]=>
 bool(false)
}
```
As you can see, the problem is a __PHP_Incomplete_Class is returned (with an associated warning in the error log that Class __PHP_Incomplete_Class has no unserializer) because the class isn't defined. Although I can define the class, I'd rather not as the lastVisits object isn't important to the information I was retrieving. Is there any chance the response of this API call will be put back to the way it was (or changed to remove or transmute the object) because, otherwise, anyone who has been using this API call will now have to modify their own code to define the object? Thanks.

title: Release Piwik 3.0.1-b1
Split "Social network" as its own referrer type in "All referrers" report

labels.name: Major
labels.description: Indicates the severity or impact or benefit of an issue is much higher than normal but not critical.

labels.name: Enhancement
labels.description: For new feature suggestions that for example enhance Matomo's cabapilities..

body:
In dashboard and referrers menu, there is a report based on social networks. When looking at the Referrer Types report, we miss these items.
By adding the social networks as a type, with there sub-items, we get a more complete overview of referrer types.
